articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Chongryon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Chongryon
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk in a compatriotic atmosphere with the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday. 
					 The group led by Kwon Sun Hui, advisor to the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan,  participated in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un by Nepalese President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un by Nepalese President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Nepalese President Ram Baran Yadav on Sept. 9.
					 The message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the happy occasion of the auspicious birthday of the DPRK and sincerely wished him good health and well-being and the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Chad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Chad
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Idriss Deby Itno, president of Chad, on September 7.
					 The president in the message extended warm greetings to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the government and people of Chad and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He, availing himself of the happy opportunity, confirmed his will to make positive efforts to further develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in the mutual interests of the two peoples, expressing satisfaction over the good relations.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un happiness in good health and the Korean people peace.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Pakistani President Mamnoon Hussain on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message said he was glad to extend the warm greetings to Kim Jong Un on the important occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK, September 9, 2013.
					
					 The two countries have the bilateral cooperative relations of mutual benefits in all fields, he said, hoping these relations would grow stronger.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity he wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on September 2.
					 The President extended warm and sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The president said he was pleased that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries that began in the year of the foundation of the DPRK have a historical tradition, and are growing stronger in all fields.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the friendly Korean people prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Alpha Conde, Guinean president, on Sept. 6.
					 The Guinean president in the message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Guinean government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The president reaffirmed the will to make efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, saying he looks back upon the glorious feats made by the great leaders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The message sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from  A. Enkhtubshin,  chairman of the Mongolian People's Party, on Sept. 3.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the WPK and the Mongolian People's Party and between the peoples of the two countries would grow stronger, and wished Kim Jong Un great success in his responsible work for the prosperity and development of the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party Leader
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from S. M. Mironov, chairman of the "A Just Russia", on Aug. 22.
					 The chairman in the message extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un and all the Korean people on behalf of the "A Just Russia" and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman noted that the historic event is a significant occasion for all the people of the DPRK.
					
					 The appearance of a new independent state for the working people on the world map 65 years ago marked one of the most important days and significant events in the modern history of the DPRK, he said.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and great success and all the people of the DPRK happiness.
					
					 He hoped that the cooperation between the two countries and the two parties would develop on good terms.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Namibian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Namibian President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, on September 2.
					 The Namibian president in the message extended the warmest greetings to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Namibia and on his own behalf on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 Namibia and the DPRK have strong and friendly ties characterized by good bilateral cooperation, the message said, reaffirming that the bilateral relations would grow stronger in the mutual interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He hoped that Kim Jong Un would enjoy good health and lead the people of the DPRK to greater economic prosperity and social well-being.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Equatorial Guinean President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, president of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, on September 7.
					 The message extended warm and sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on behalf of the government and people of Equatorial Guinea on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, the president reaffirmed his will to strengthen and develop the good friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Tanzanian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Tanzanian President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, president of the United Republic of Tanzania, on September 3.
					 The president extended sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un and through him, to the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Tanzania on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK, September 9.
					
					 The president, availing himself of the opportunity, expressed his heartfelt satisfaction over the good friendly and historic relations between the governments and peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He on this important day reaffirmed his will to further strengthen and develop the friendly ties and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Message of Greeting from Rwandan President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Message of Greeting from Rwandan President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Paul Kagame, president of the Republic of Rwanda, on September 6.
					 The president in the message extended warm greetings and sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Rwanda and on his own behalf on the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, the president reaffirmed his will to further develop the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Tajik President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Tajik President
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Emomali Rahmon, president of the Republic of Tajikistan, on September 3.
					 The message extended sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK, national holiday.
					
					 The president, availing himself of the opportunity, wished Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work and the people of the DPRK well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Cuban State Leader Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cuban State Leader Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
 Havana, September 12 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Havana on September 9, the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Cuban Foreign Minister Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla also sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Baskets, Bouquet to DPRK Embassies from Personages of Indonesia, Benin
articles.content:
Floral Baskets, Bouquet to DPRK Embassies from Personages of Indonesia, Benin
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Personages of various circles in Indonesia sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Jakarta on Sept. 6 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included the general chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the speaker and deputy speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly, the speaker of the House of People's Representatives and the directors of several companies of Indonesia.
					
					 The floral baskets were placed before a full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing together with general secretary Kim Jong Il and portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The president of the Socialist Party of Benin sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou on Sept. 5.

articles.title: House Moving Goes On in Unha Scientists Street
articles.content:
House Moving Goes On in Unha Scientists Street
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Families of scientists are moving to new houses in Unha Scientists Street here, built under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The houses, each consisting of 3~5 living rooms, are furnished with 10-odd pieces of quality furniture and with daily necessities.
					
					 Kim Jong Un suggested building the street for scientists making big contributions to beefing up the nation's defence capabilities and building a strong economy.
					
					 Associate Professor Jo Jong Hye, whose husband is a winner of the title of People's Scientist and the February 16 Science and Technology Prize, told KCNA:
					
					 "This is five-room house we are to live in.
					
					 My daughter and son-in-law are scientists, too. They are also honored to receive a new house in this street.
					
					 Whenever new houses were built for scientists, we have always been the first mover to them.
					
					 I am most grateful to Marshal Kim Jong Un for his loving care."
					
					 A woman scientist, Yang Sun Ok who moved to a new house which Kim Jong Un visited, said:
					
					 "My new house is as gorgeous as palace.
					
					 I was so blissful that I sat up all night, talking with my family members about the loving care of Kim Jong Un and about the will to repay it."

articles.title: Plenary Meeting of UAWK Held
articles.content:
Plenary Meeting of UAWK Held
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The 67th plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) took place here on Friday.
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the UAWK and chairpersons of the city and county committees of the union.
					
					 They discussed the tasks for the union to carry out the tasks set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution".
					
					 A report by Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C. C., UAWK, was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said Kim Jong Un's work reflects the boundless loyalty to the leader and conviction and optimism for final victory, adding that it serves as guidelines that illuminate the way to be followed by the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun.
					
					 They made proposals for the union organizations at all levels and their members to carry out the tasks advanced in the work.
					
					 They appealed to the agricultural workers to be patriotic farmers in the era of Songun in the drive to boost the agricultural production by displaying the "speed on Masik Pass."

articles.title: Asian Weightlifting Championship Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
Asian Weightlifting Championship Opens in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The 2013 Asian Cup and Interclub Junior and Senior Weightlifting Championship was opened here on Thursday.
					 The Asian Cup Weightlifting Championship has been held since 2011 while the Asian Interclub Weightlifting Championship has long been sponsored by the Asian Weightlifting Federation.
					
					 The on-going tournament represents the two championships, thereby coming under the spotlight of world's experts.
					
					 It is attended by the competition director of the International Weightlifting Federation, the general secretary of the Asian Weightlifting Federation and other figures of the world weightlifting circles.
					
					 The championship drew many weightlifters from 10 odd countries and regions.
					
					 Kim Kwang Dok, general secretary of the Korean Weightlifting Association, told KCNA:
					
					 "Some countries selected top weightlifters several times for the championship. The DPRK weightlifters, too, are well prepared in physical and technical aspects.
					
					 In cooperation with the Asian Weightlifting Federation, the Korean Weightlifting Association is now doing its best so that the championship can be conducive to developing the weightlifting techniques of countries and regions."

articles.title: DPRK Wins 12 Gold Medals in 1st-Day Competitions of Asian Weightlifting Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wins 12 Gold Medals in 1st-Day Competitions of Asian Weightlifting Championship
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The 2013 Asian Cup and Interclub Junior and Senior Weightlifting Championship is going on here.
					 DPRK women made good results in the 1st-day competitions on Thursday.
					
					 Ri Jong Hui and Kim Chung Sim took the titles in the Asian Cup junior women's 48 and 53 kg categories and Paek Il Hwa and Kim Su Ryon in the Asian Interclub junior women's 48 and 53 kg.
					
					 That day DPRK captured 12 gold, six silver and one bronze medals in total.
					
					 Kim Su Ryon, who bagged three gold medals with 193 kg in total, told KCNA that she would intensify training to get more gold medals in the future international tournaments.
					
					 Kim Chung Sim, a winner of two gold and one silver medals, said:
					
					 "I felt great strength, picturing respected Marshal Kim Jong Un seeing me in competition.
					
					 I will display the honor of country with gold medals in the future, too."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Intention to Acquire Right to Collective Self-defense
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Intention to Acquire Right to Collective Self-defense
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government would be well advised to stop such foolish act as  inviting misfortune, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Japan sustained a defeat after invading various Asian countries and provoking the Pacific war but it is now becoming evermore desperate in its efforts to acquire the right to collective self-defense.
					
					 The Japanese government is expanding the scope of reexamining the interpretation of the Constitution.
					
					 It is mulling stepping up the reexamination of the interpretation of the Constitution in a bid to justify the exercise of the right to collective self-defense under the pretext that Japan's security environment has become serious due to "north Korea's successful test-fire of long-range ballistic missile", "Chinese Navy's intensified advance into ocean," etc.
					
					 The difference between the ongoing move of the Japanese government and its past one is that it is aimed to allow the exercise of that right in all aspects, not in a limited scope. Herein lies the gravity of the development.
					
					 The real aim sought by the present Japanese government in its move to fully exercise the right to collective self-defense is to realize the ambition to turn Japan into a military giant with the backing of the U.S. and reinvade Asian countries.
					
					 If Japan stages military actions in the northeast Asian region together with the U.S., they will deteriorate the regional situation. Japan's Self-Defense Forces are capable of advancing not only into Northeast Asia but into the Asia-Pacific region and fighting a war without difficulty. 
					
					 Japan is emerging new aggressor forces arousing caution and concern of the world.
					
					 If the Japanese government follows in the footsteps of the past aggressors, it will lead Japan to a total ruin.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Bugging International Organizations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Bugging International Organizations
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The German weekly magazine Spiegel exposed that the U.S. information-gathering agency wiretapped the head office of the UN in New York.
					 The U.S. National Security Agency bugged diplomatic missions to the UN in Washington DC and New York and those of 28 member states of the European Union in Brussels and overheard private conversations, British paper The Guardian reported.
					
					 A commentary on Rodong Sinmun Friday says that it testified to the fact that the U.S. did all sorts of vices including spying to meet its criminal goal, taking no account of the international organization.
					
					 The U.S. does vices in international organizations the same way as in its own country, the commentary notes and goes on:
					
					 The international organizations including the UN and the diplomatic missions have been reserved to be inviolable with their functions protected by Vienna Convention and other international conventions.
					
					 The UN member states are under obligation to assure inviolability for all the diplomatic missions.
					
					 The U.S. is without exception as it is one of the UN member states.
					
					 However, the U.S. set the head office of the UN as the object of wiretapping as it looks down on the body.
					
					 The U.S. often cries out for "freedom" and "democracy" and admonishes other countries over "human rights performances". 
					
					 It had better behave itself, not meddling in the internal affairs of other countries.

articles.title: Art Performance Marks DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Art Performance Marks DPRK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A performance of the Song and Dance Ensemble of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) has been given at the Ponghwa Art Theatre. September 13 is the last day of the performance which began to celebrate the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Among the audience were officials of the armed forces organs, service personnel of the Korean People's Army, creators and artistes in the field of literature and arts as well as people from all walks of life and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers like chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", male tenor trio "I Don't Know Other Embrace More Kind than Yours" and female solo and small chorus "Believe in Tomorrow".
					
					 Performers praised exploits performed by Generalissimo Kim Il Sung in nation-building.
					
					 They emotionally represented the strong yearnings of the army and people for Generalissimo Kim Jong Il in numbers like male solo and chorus "Oh, My Motherland of Songun" and yanggum and female solo "Thinking of Journeys for Songun Leadership".
					
					 The repertoire also included choruses "Our Leader Respected by the People" and "We Will Defend General Kim Jong Un at the Cost of Our Lives" representing the will of the army and people to be royal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Leave 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Archives Administration of China headed by Deputy Director-General Li Heping and Johannes Plug, member of Bundestag of Germany from the Social-Democratic Party, and his party left here on Friday.

articles.title: Kangwon Province Benefits from Power Stations
articles.content:
Kangwon Province Benefits from Power Stations
 Wonsan, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Wonsan Youth Power Station, Anbyon Youth Power Station No. 2 and other hydraulic power stations built in Kangwon Province are contributing to the economic development of the province and the improvement of the people's living standard.
					 With the satisfactory supply of electricity, the factories and enterprises in the province are boosting the production under  scrupulous plans.
					
					 The Wonsan Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory, Munchon Foodstuff Factory, Wonsan Glass Bottle Factory and other factories in the light industrial field are increasing the production of consumer goods by raising the operational ratio of machines.
					
					 The Munchon Valve Factory, Kosan Koryo Medicine Factory, Thongchon County Farm Machine Station and other factories are making an efficient use of electricity.
					
					 The education, scientific research and prophylactic treatment are effectively under way and public catering and service amenities are in better operation.
					
					 Night view of Wonsan is all the more gratifying with children roller-skating at the pleasure grounds and parks as bright as day and streets brightly decorated with peculiar lighting.

articles.title: Electricity Production Increases in Huichon Power Stations
articles.content:
Electricity Production Increases in Huichon Power Stations
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Huichon Power Stations have over-fulfilled its monthly plans at around 105 percent since it went operational.
					 The officials, workers and technicians of the power stations introduced over 10 proposals for technical updating by pooling their wisdom and displaying creative ingenuity.
					
					 The employees of Power Station No. 2 established a gravity-fed coolant supply system and renovated the speed controller, thereby increasing the hourly generation of electricity.
					
					 Power Station No. 1 has installed necessary equipment and parts to over-fulfill the daily, monthly and quarterly plans.
					
					 The officials and workers of the structure shop of the Huichon Dam and the management station of the Ryongrim Dam set up a strict check-up and repair system for structure and floodgates, controlling water on a scientific basis.
					
					 The employees of the Huichon Power Stations are working hard to increase the production of electricity to supply more power to various sectors.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 65th birthday of the DPRK visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					 Members of the group paid tribute to the statue of President Kim Il Sung acknowledging the cheering crowds at a square where a military parade was held.
					
					 They paid respects to the service personnel of the Korean People's Army before the sculpture "Victory," the monument to the victory in war.
					
					 They went round several halls of the museum.
					
					 They also visited the KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment, Pyongyang Folklore Park and other places.

articles.title: Song "Ode to the Motherland" Created in DPRK
articles.content:
Song "Ode to the Motherland" Created in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A song "Ode to the Motherland" was recently created in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as a national treasure.
					 The song, vibrant with feelings of ardent love for the motherland, reminds one of the tireless efforts devoted by President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il for the prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of its people.
					
					 It also reflects the steadfast will of the Korean people to glorify the socialist motherland, built and developed by the President and the leader.
					
					 Lyric and melodic, the song is a favorite for everyone.
					
					 In the 1st stanza, the song says that one can enjoy a worthwhile life only under the care of the motherland. 
					
					 In the 2nd and 3rd stanzas, it speaks highly of the DPRK where everything serves for the popular masses.
					
					 In the 4th and 5th stanzas, it calls for devoting one's all to the prosperity of the country led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Inspired by the song, the DPRK people have turned out in the efforts for the prosperity of the country with their strong will to further glorify the history of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.

articles.title: DPRK Directs Big Efforts to Science Development
articles.content:
DPRK Directs Big Efforts to Science Development
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Unha Scientists Street has been built here under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The DPRK Government is planning to give precedence to building dwelling houses and rest homes for scientists and educationists in the field of construction.
					
					 The measure is a representation of the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 The policy serves as an impetus to speeding up the building of a thriving socialist nation in the country.
					
					 After the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, President Kim Il Sung had paid deep attention to developing the nation's science and technology, putting forward intellectuals as one of the driving forces of the revolution along with the workers and peasants.
					
					 He founded the Academy of Sciences in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953) and recalled servicepersons from the front to study at universities.
					
					 Thanks to the measures he took in a far-sighted manner, the DPRK could successfully finish the post-war rehabilitation and lay a sound foundation for the self-supporting national economy in a short span of time.
					
					 Kim Il Sung's idea of attaching importance to science had been creditably carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Determined to build IT-based economy in the country, Kim Jong Il personally paved a way for turning the nation's industry into a CNC-based one in the 1990s when the country was undergoing trials.
					
					 He set 1999 as a year of science and made his first field guidance for the year to the State Academy of Sciences.
					
					 Thanks to his energetic efforts, the country turned into a satellite manufacturing and launching state and many modernly-equipped industrial establishments sprung up across the country.
					
					 The country's science and technology are now developing onto a higher level under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: End to Corruption Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
End to Corruption Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean daily Kukmin Ilbo Tuesday carried an editorial demanding an end to illegality and corruption.
					 The editorial recalled that for over 10 years the authorities have refused the collection of the assets which Chun Doo Hwan illegally grabbed while in power.
					
					 The government and the prosecution will be left with no excuses as they overlooked Chun's illegalities while demanding the people obey the law, it noted.
					
					 It is a hard fact that Chun's families amassed assets with the slush money he received as bribes during his tenure of office, an unpardonable act, the editorial said.
					
					 It has been long since south Korea was called a shameful "republic plagued by corruption" for the unabated occurrences of all kinds of illegalities and corruption cases, the editorial deplored, adding:
					
					 The failure in combating graft amounts to adding another crime.

articles.title: Crackdown upon Reunification Movement under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Crackdown upon Reunification Movement under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- More than 100 organizations and over 600 figures in south Korea and abroad issued a declaration on the situation on September 11 in denunciation of the puppet group's crackdown upon the south headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) and their movement for reunification.
					 The declaration denounced the present ruling force for not only suppressing organizations and figures who called for the improvement of the south-north relations and peace on the Korean Peninsula, being critical of the "government", on charges of violation of the "National Security Law" (NSL) but also arresting them by labeling them as "followers of the north" and "communists".
					
					 The declaration said that after the "Saenuri Party" took office, there was a drastic increase of cases in which various circles desirous of the implementation of the south-north joint declaration and stop to the joint military drills with the U.S. were suppressed, being branded as "enemy-benefiting".
					
					 In particular, the on-going crackdown upon the south headquarters of Pomminryon indicates the likelihood of surging storm of crackdown upon the pro-reunification organizations and figures on charges of violation of the "NSL", it held.
					
					 It noted that even the UN is demanding the repeal of the evil law, a copy of the Japanese "Maintenance of the Public Order Act".
					
					 It said the interference in the presidential election engineered by the National Intelligence Service (NIS) as an extension of infliction of sufferings on the people by dint of the evil and undemocratic law is sparking off a social furor.
					
					 It can not but be an act of "undermining the existence and security" to deprive the people of their rights by mobilizing the power for the political interests of the specified force.
					
					 It called for an immediate stop to the fascist violence of branding the demands of the people as acts "following the north" and "benefiting the enemy".

articles.title: Juvenile Suicide Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Juvenile Suicide Unabated in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Yonhap News and Hankuk Ilbo of south Korea reported that the juvenile suicide has become a serious problem in south Korea.
					 A relevant institution said on Sept. 10 that the suicide rate is on the increase among teenagers.
					
					 The rising rate is allegedly attributable to violence at schools, sexual abuses, family discord, heavy burden of tuition and other factors.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Denounce Authorities for Cooking Up Case of Plotted Rebellion
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Denounce Authorities for Cooking Up Case of Plotted Rebellion 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press interview at its conference hall on Sept. 10 to denounce the "government" authorities for plotting a case of rebellion.
					 The speakers said the Intelligence Service plotted the case of rebellion against the opposition party to cover up its intervention in the election, thus challenging the public.
					
					 The spearhead would inevitably be directed to the working people strongly calling for democracy and right to existence, they stated, and went on:
					
					 The recent case helped them realize that the plotted rebellion case can put in danger the opposition party and the progressive forces alike.
					
					 They will never overlook the authorities' suppression of freedom of thinking and conscience but turn out to fight for the right to existence against the suppression by the security authorities to build an ideal society desired by the workers.
					
					 They vowed to wage unflinching actions for the abolition of the "National Security Law" and the reform of social system.
					
					 A declaration was read out at the interview in which the workers denounced the puppet authorities for plotting the case and demanded the abolition of the fascist evil law.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was published in booklet by the Antri Miek Publishing House of Cambodia.
					 The work, made public on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It also indicates the tasks to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A releasing ceremony was held at the publishing house on September 7.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Celebrate DPRK Birthday
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Celebrate DPRK Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- An event of Korean residents in the Maritime Territory of Russia was held at the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka on Sept. 5 to mark the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Present there were chairpersons of self-governing associations for Korean National Culture in Nakhodka and Partizansk, other compatriots and consuls of the consulate general.
					
					 Displayed in the venue were photos documenting the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in the nation-building and photos dealing with the great feats general secretary Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed in bolstering up the defence capability of the country and improving the people's living standard.
					
					 Also on display there were famous works of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, photos showing the invincible might of Songun Korea, books on their greatness, magazines and picture albums.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before a full-length picture of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing on Mt. Paektu and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Then they looked round the photos and books on display and watched the Korean film "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu."
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers said that Kim Il Sung was the founder of socialist Korea who founded the DPRK, set up a genuine power for the people and successfully achieved the cause of building an independent and sovereign state.
					
					 They lauded Kim Jong Il for defending socialism by smashing the ceaseless moves of the U.S. imperialists to isolate and stifle the DPRK with arms of Songun, and turning it into an invincible politico-ideological power.
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Un is successfully implementing the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, they said thanks to the seasoned leadership of Kim Jong Un the Korean people are registering astonishing successes in the building of an economic power and highly civilized nation.
					
					 They stressed the need for all Koreans to unite under the banner of "By our nation itself" and intensify the movement for reunification.

articles.title: British Organizations Congratulate Korean People on DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
British Organizations Congratulate Korean People on DPRK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- British organizations issued congratulatory statements on September 4 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said in a joint statement that the DPRK has pursued Juche-oriented policies, holding fast to the revolutionary principle of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The DPRK has developed into a genuine socialist state centred on the popular masses free from exploitation and oppression.
					
					 The DPRK is, indeed, a paradise for the people.
					
					 The DPRK led by supreme leader Kim Jong Un has dynamically advanced for a final victory, holding fast to the Songun revolutionary line under the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					 The Korean people are stepping up the drive to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Staffordshire, Britain, Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in its statement referred to the glorious history of the DPRK. It noted:
					
					 The key to the proud victory achieved by the DPRK lies in that it has pursued the great Songun politics, thoroughly preserving the Juche character and national character in the revolution and construction.
					
					 All miraculous successes achieved in the building of a thriving socialist nation in the DPRK are linked with the august names of great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Glory to the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Laos, Romania and France from September 2 to 5 to mark the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 On display in the venues of the meetings were photos showing the proud history of the DPRK in which it has traversed the road of victory and glory under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were personages of various circles and masses in the relevant countries.
					
					 Tong Yeu Tho, chairperson of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, said the Korean people have maintained the principle of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea.
					
					 The traits of attaching importance to military affairs prevail in whole society and all-people defence system has been established in the DPRK, which exerts primary efforts for increasing its military power, the chairperson noted, adding the DPRK has turned into a military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke.
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union, said Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, who carried forward the revolutionary cause of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, frustrated all moves of the imperialists with his original Songun politics and provided an eternal foundation for prosperity.
					
					 The secretary general of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said the founding of the DPRK marked a great event in the 20th century as it demonstrated the will of the Korean people to build an independent sovereign state though they had been subject to aggression and plunder by powers in the past.
					
					 The progressive people are expressing firm solidarity with the Korean people who are dynamically pushing ahead with the building of an economic power while firmly ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and foiling the arbitrary and high-handed practices of the U.S. with their strong capabilities for national defence, the secretary general stressed.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked by Guinean Organization
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked by Guinean Organization
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a bulletin on September 4 to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The bulletin carried articles titled "Invincible power" and "65 years of victory and glory".
					
					 The bulletin in an article titled "DPRK Today" said:
					
					 The DPRK has greeted the greatest heyday in its development. It is a country strong in independence and invincible in its military power.
					
					 It has stepped up the building of an economic power and channeled great efforts into the building of a highly civilized socialist nation, resolutely foiling the ceaseless challenge and increasing nuclear threat of the U.S. in particular.
					
					 The cause of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the Korean people who are dynamically advancing toward rosy future under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Koreans' Just Cause Supported by Polish Organization
articles.content:
Koreans' Just Cause Supported by Polish Organization 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The Polish Branch of the Korean Friendship Association released a statement on September 5 to celebrate the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Thanks to the victory in the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung, the Korean people were liberated from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and became masters of their own destinies. The DPRK was founded on September 9, 1948 by the unanimous will of the Koreans.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, from the initial stage of nation-building, oriented his work to carving out a new road suited to the specific condition of the country, building of socialism guided by the Juche idea.
					
					 By applying the principle of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence, the DPRK turned into a political and military power strong in the sense of independence, while foiling all the moves of the U.S. imperialists to stifle it.
					
					 Now Marshal Kim Jong Un set it as the principal task of the Workers' Party of Korea to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard and is wisely leading it.
					
					 The DPRK has set many goals for the improvement of people's material and cultural life including the construction of the Masik Pass Ski Resort and is successfully carrying them out.
					
					 The statement warmly congratulated the Korean people greeting the 65th anniversary of the DPRK, extending full support and solidarity to their just cause.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Observed in Ethiopia, Germany, Indonesia
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Observed in Ethiopia, Germany, Indonesia
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks took place in Ethiopia, Germany and Indonesia between Aug. 30 and Sept. 6 to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The participants unanimously lauded President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il for their undying exploits of founding the DPRK and developing it into a socialist state with invincible might through their outstanding and tested leadership.
					
					 Referring to the advantages and solidity of the socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK, they said the country has been greatly admired by the world progressive people.
					
					 They reaffirmed that the Korean people would certainly build a thriving socialist nation and accomplish the cause of national reunification in the near future under the wise leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, who is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Provincia de Kangwon se beneficia de electricidad
articles.content:
Provincia de Kangwon se beneficia de electricidad
 Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La Planta Hidroelectrica Juventud de Wonsan, la otra Juventud no. 2 de Anbyon y otras centrales electricas contribuyen al desarrollo economico y la mejora de vida del pueblo de la provincia de Kwangwon al aumentar la produccion de  electricidad.
					 A medida de que se suministra suficientemente la electricidad, las fabricas y empresas de la provincia organizan con escrupulosidad la labor economica e impulsan con vigor la produccion.
					
					 La Fabrica de Articulos Plasticos de Uso Diario de Ex Militares Minusvalidos de Wonsan, la Fabrica de Alimentos de Munchon, la Fabrica de Botellas de Vidrio de Wonsan y otras fabricas de industria ligera elevan la tasa de operacion de las maquinas y aumentan la produccion de articulos de consumo popular.
					
					 La Fabrica de Valvulas de Munchon, la Fabrica de Medicinas de Coryo de Kosan, la Estacion de Maquinas Agricolas del distrito de Thongchon y otras unidades aprovechan eficazmente la electricidad.
					
					 Se desarrollan activamente la educacion, la investigacion cientifica y el tratamiento preventivo y se gestionan bien las redes de servicios gastronomicos y publicos.
					
					 Es agradable ver a los ninos que juegan a patines de ruedas en los parques y las avenidas nocturnas de la ciudad de Wonsan decoradas con luces electricas.

articles.title: Funcion del Conjunto Artistico de ESIPC
articles.content:
Funcion del Conjunto Artistico de ESIPC
 Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se efectuo hasta el dia 13 en el Teatro de Arte Ponghwa la funcion del Conjunto Artistico del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea (ESIPC) iniciada con motivo del 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  La vieron los funcionarios de las instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, creadores y artistas de la rama de literatura y arte y trabajadores de distintos estratos, jovenes y estudiantes de esta capital.
					
					  En la escena se pusieron el coro "!Viva el Generalisimo Kim Il Sung!", el solo femenino y coro pequeno "Que confien en el futuro" y otras piezas.
					
					  Los ejecutantes elogiaron las hazanas del Generalisimo en la fundacion de la RPDC.
					
					  El solo masculino y coro "Mi patria del Songun" y otras piezas describieron con profunda emocion la anoranza ardiente de todos los militares y civiles al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  El coro "Nuestro Dirigente adorado por el pueblo", "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un", etc. reflejan la conviccion de todos los militares y civiles de apoyar fielmente la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Convocada 67a sesion plenaria del CC de UTAC
articles.content:
Convocada 67a sesion plenaria del CC de UTAC
 Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Fue convocada el dia 13 en esta capital la 67a sesion plenaria del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea (UTAC) con la participacion de los miembros y otros suplentes de esta organizacion y los presidentes de los comites de la UTAC en las ciudades y los distritos.
					 En la ocasion fue abordada la tarea de las organizaciones de la UTAC para materializar las tareas presentadas en la obra del Mariscal Kim Jong Un "Hagamos perpetuas la gran idea revolucionaria de Songun del companero Kim Jong Il y sus hazanas".
					
					 Hubo el informe del presidente del CC de la UTAC Ri Myong Gil y las intervenciones.
					
					 Los oradores enfatizaron que la obra del Mariscal llena de la infinita fidelidad al lider y la conviccion y el optimismo de la victoria final sirve de una guia programatica que ilumina el camino de seguir por la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la del Songun.
					
					 La reunion presento los remedios a ser tomados por las organizaciones a todos los niveles y los miembros de la entidad para materializar las tareas presentadas en la obra.
					
					 Y exhorto a los trabajadores agricolas a avivar mas furiosamente las llamas de creacion de la "Velocidad de Masikryong" para que se hagan campesinos patrioticos de la epoca del Songun en aumentar la produccion cerealista.

articles.title: Central hidroelectrica de Huichon sobrecumple su plan
articles.content:
Central hidroelectrica de Huichon sobrecumple su plan 
 Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Despues de inaugurada, la central hidroelectrica de Huichon sobrecumplio en mas de 5% cada plan mensual.
					 Los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos de la central introdujeron mas de 10 innovaciones tecnologicas, poniendo de pleno manifiesto sus inteligencias y facultades creadoras.
					
					 Los productores de la central no.2 realizaron  el sistema de suministracion de agua refrigerante a las instalaciones generadoras segun la gravedad y renovaron el aparato de control de velocidad y otros para aumentar la produccion  de energia electrica por hora.
					
					 En la central no.1, fabricaron y montaron las instalaciones y elementos necesarios, asi que sobrecumplen el plan diario, mensual y trimestral.
					
					 Los funcionarios y obreros del taller de estructuras del dique de Huichon y la empresa del dique de Ryongrim establecieron el sistema de inspeccion y reparacion de las estructuras y las compuertas para hacer de manera cientifica la administracion de agua.
					
					 En la actualidad, los funcionarios y obreros de esta central siguen esforzandose por aumentar la produccion de electricidad y enviarla a diversas ramas de la economia nacional.
